intro: Austrosynotis, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the south-western regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Austrosynotis typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. It is an important plant for local pollinators and has cultural significance to Indigenous communities.
